artist: Designer: Typography by Il'ia Zdanevich, called Iliazd; Author: Il'ia Zdanevich, called Iliazd; Designer: Cover design by Naum Granovskii; Publisher: Éditions du degré 41, Paris
catalogue_raissonne: MOMA 458-459; Getty 249; Compton, p. 61ff; Pompidou: Dada 1253; Isselbacher 8; Rowell & Wye 459; Johnson 37; Stein 30
creditline: The Mary and Robyn Campbell Fund for Art Books
description: cover collage on grey paper of variously shaped elements of gold foil, patterned silver foil, leatherette and cork, with text and date printed in black; letterpress text in various fonts and designs; top of pages uncut (each page folded); prospectus with preface in French by Georges Ribemont-Dessaignes loosely inserted
inscription: Inscriptions on flyleaf, in black ink: [A Marcello Fabri / Iliazd / 7.2.24]; in pencil: [B88854-4 [Iliazd (w/ loose pamphlet)]; on top of preface insert, in pencil: [with B88854-4]
medium: Letterpress typographical designs; cover design in foil, leatherette, cork
provenance: The artist, gift to Marcello Fabri, 7/02/24; […]; sold by a private antiquarian bookseller, Paris, to Ars Libri, Boston, April, 2010; Ars Libri sold to MIA, September, 2010
signed: Signed and dated on flyleaf in black ink as part of dedication inscription
title: Lidantiu as a Beacon
